text: Holy carp, we're heading to a world beneath the waves, one that's more fin-tastically connected to our everyday lives than you might think. It's the fascinating realm of fish farming. Imagine this. Huge underwater plantations buzzing with life. Here's a fact that might surprise you. A lot of the fish we eat doesn't come from wild, vast oceans. Nope, it actually comes from these fish farms. In fact, more than half of all seafood we eat worldwide is produced through fish farming. This food production method is vital for feeding our continuously growing population. So, the next time you're enjoying a tasty salmon sushi or mouth-watering shrimp scampi, just remember it's not only a yummy dish, it's a great achievement of human innovation.
